verses.roman:
gopās tam anvasajjanta
nandādyāḥ śakaṭais tataḥ
ādāyopāyanaṁ bhūri
kumbhān go-rasa-sambhṛtān

synonyms: gopāḥ—the cowherd men; tam—Him; anvasajjanta—followed; nanda-ādyāḥ—headed by Nanda; śakaṭaiḥ—in their wagons; tataḥ—then; ādāya—having taken; upāyanam—offerings; bhūri—abundant; kumbhān—clay pots; go-rasa—with milk products; sambhṛtān—filled.
translation: Led by Nanda Mahārāja, the cowherd men followed behind Lord Kṛṣṇa in their wagons. The men brought along many offerings for the King, including clay pots filled with ghee and other milk products.
